titleproper.value:
Guide to the Records of the Office of the Dean, University College of Arts and Pure Science (Francis Hovey Stoddard) 
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1904-1936 </date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>RG 18.0.1</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Geri Solomon and Cynthia Siu.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-09-27T14:21-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the Office of the Dean, University College of Arts and Pure Science

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Francis Hovey Stoddard was a writer, educator and administrator born in 1847 in Middlebury, Vermont. In 1888 Stoddard came to New York University assuming a position in the newly created Department of English Language and Literature. In 1910 Stoddard was appointed Dean of University College of Arts and Pure Science. He retired from New York University in 1914 and died in New York City in 1936. The records include correspondence, writings and clippings that document Stoddard's tenure at NYU.

p.value: Please contact the University Archivists with specific questions regarding restrictions.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Records of the Office of the Dean, University College of Arts and Pure Science; RG 18. 0. 1.; box number; folder number;
                <lb/>
                <address>
                    <addressline>New York University Archives
                        <lb/> </addressline>
                    <addressline>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
                        <lb/> </addressline>
                    <addressline>70 Washington Square South
                        <lb/> </addressline>
                    <addressline>New York, NY 10012</addressline>
                </address>, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Annual Reports, 1910-1914. 
                        <title render="italic">Report of the Dean of the College of Arts and Pure Science</title>.</item>
                    <item>Chamberlain, Joshua., ed., 
                        <title render="italic">Universities and Their Sons: New York University</title>. Vol.1 (183- ), Boston: R. Herdon Company, 1901.</item>
                    <item>Jones, Theodore F., ed., 
                        <title render="italic">New York University 1832-1932</title> . New York: New York University Press, 1933. </item>
                    <item>Marquis, Albert Nelson, ed., 
                        <title render="italic">Who's Who in America</title> . Vol.16. Chicago: A.N. Marquis Company, 1930-1931.</item>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">New York University Catalogue</title> , vols. 1888-1914. New York: New York University Press, 1888-1914.</item>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">National Encyclopedia of American Business</title> . Vol.XXVII. "A Talk with professor Stoddard. ca.1912. A report by a former student on a visit with Stoddard."</item>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">The 20th Century Biographical Dictionary of Notable Americans</title>. University Senate Minutes, 1896-1914.</item>
                </list>

Series III focuses on topics and issues of interest to Stoddard and to the Office of the Dean. The files contain correspondence with numerous authors represented in each folder. The material is arranged alphabetically, then chronologically within each folder. Of particular interest are files on the Preparatory Schools Committee that document a program in which faculty visited New York high schools to promote New York University and to recruit students. The New York State Department of Education files illustrate initial efforts of New York State to standardize education.

corpname.value: Washington Square College of Arts and Science.
